item.title: My pup Theo <3
item.description: Meet my 7 month old Chow Chow, Theo!

item.title: Python, R, & Reticulate
item.description: Lists & Indexing in Python list1=['I','love','my', 'dog', 'Theo', 'me', 'loves'] list1[0:5] ## ['I', 'love', 'my', 'dog', 'Theo'] list1.append('and') list1[-1] ## 'and' list1[2:5] ## ['my', 'dog', 'Theo'] list1[6] ## 'loves' list1[5] ## 'me' Combining R & Python #my code in R string1<-c("I love my") #my code in Python import re string2="dog Theo" string3="dore" print(r.string1, string2) ## I love my dog Theo print(r.string1, (string2 + string3)) ## I love my dog Theodore

item.title: Creating a New Theme
item.description: Introduction This tutorial will show you how to create a simple theme in Hugo. I assume that you are familiar with HTML, the bash command line, and that you are comfortable using Markdown to format content. I’ll explain how Hugo uses templates and how you can organize your templates to create a theme. I won’t cover using CSS to style your theme. We’ll start with creating a new site with a very basic template.
